raw_text:
DOCUMENT 1
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
5/2/2024 4:52 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,
Respondent,
v.
CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND,
Petitioner.
CONTEMPT PETITION
COMES NOW, Petitioner-Mother BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND (hereinafter
“Mother”), by and through her undersigned counsel of record, Barbara H. Agricola and Matthew
A. Holdren, of Agricola Law, LLC, in the above-styled cause and states unto this Honorable Court
as follows:
Background:
1. That on February 27, 2024, this Court entered a Final Decree of Divorce (“Decree”)
between the Parties, wherein specific terms were ordered concerning custody, visitation,
property distribution, and other relational conduct between the Parties. The Parties share
two (2) Minor Children, namely, A.K. (d.o.b.: 5/24/2012) and B.M. (d.o.b.: (5.10.2019).
Allegations of Contempt:
2. Respondent-Father, Christopher Blaine McGregor (hereinafter “Father”), was ordered,
inter alia, to adhere to specific provisions regarding custody, visitation, property division,
and child support, which are enumerated in detail in the Decree. Since the issuance of the
Decree, Father has willfully and repeatedly violated the Court’s order in ways that are
detrimental to Mother, the Minor Children’s well-being, and Mother's rights as detailed
hereinbelow.
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 1 of 8
DOCUMENT 1
Father has Blocked/Withheld Visitation in direct violation of the Court’ Final Order:
3. Since Mother filed her Motion to Alter Amend or Vacate the Final Decree of the Divorce,
Father has intensified his efforts to alienate the children from Mother.1
4. Father has unilaterally decided to withhold visitation, contrary to the Decree’s stipulations
for joint legal custody and scheduled custodial time with Mother. Father has violated
Mother’s visitation rights by not allowing her to see A.K. since March 27, 2024, directly
contravening the specified visitation schedule in the Decree.
5. Pursuant to Paragraph 13 of the Final Order, Mother shall pick up the Minor Children from
school on Thursday and shall have them in her custody until they are returned to school the
following Monday morning. This shall occur the first and third weekends of each month.
Father has prevented Mother from picking up the Minor Children from school during her
scheduled custodial time and has actively hindered her communication with the Minor
Children’s school. He has informed the school that she is not permitted on school grounds
and has blocked any contact with the school due to false statements and misrepresentations
to school officials as to the custody rights of Mother. This has directly impacted Mother’s
ability to be involved in the Minor Children’s schooling and is a direct violation of the
Court’s Order.
Severe Parental Alienation in violation of ¶¶ 13, 14, 22 of the Court’s Final Order:
6. Father has engaged in a pattern of behavior including making derogatory comments about
Mother in front of the children, and manipulating the children’s perceptions of Mother,
which directly violates the decree’s clear directives against such conduct.
1 Mother’s Motion to Alter, Amend, or Vacate is still currently pending before this Court is Case No. DR-23-
900051.00.
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 2 of 8
DOCUMENT 1
7. Father has systematically alienated A.K. from Mother through derogatory comments and
psychological manipulation, labeling Mother as a “gas lighter,” “narcissist,” and “child
abuser” in front of A.K.
8. Father has unilaterally removed A.K. from activities she shared with Mother, such as dance
classes, further isolating her from Mother.
9. These actions are willful and in direct violation of the Court’s Final Order. Mother requests
the Court hold Father in willful contempt and grant the proper relief to Mother.
Misrepresentations and Psychological Manipulation in violation of ¶ 22 of the Court’s Final
Order:
10. Father has misrepresented loving messages from Mother to A.K. as suggestive of self-
harm, causing distress and manipulating the situation to depict Mother as mentally
unstable.
11. During Easter, Father threatened to involve the police and falsely accused Mother of
causing physical harm to A.K. using this fabricated scenario to further alienate Mother
from her daughter.
12. These actions are willful and in direct violation of the Decree. Mother requests the Court
hold Father in willful contempt and grant the proper relief to Mother.
Harassment and Embarrassment in violation of ¶¶ 5, 22 of the Court’s Final Order:
13. Father’s actions, including making unfounded accusations and derogatory comments
publicly and within the community, constitute harassment and are intended to embarrass
and humiliate Mother, which is expressly forbidden by the decree.
14. The Father has driven past Mother's home to intimidate her and falsely claimed she was
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 3 of 8
DOCUMENT 1
not a fit parent because her car was not in the driveway, directly harassing and attempting
to humiliate her.
15. Father has used social media to defame Mother, falsely stating she is a child abuser and
undermining her role and reputation as a parent.
16. These actions are willful and in direct violation of the Decree. Mother requests the Court
hold Father in willful contempt and grant the proper relief to Mother.
Property Distribution and Financial Non-Compliance in violation of ¶¶ 7, 8 of the Court’s
Final Order:
17. Father has both delayed and defaulted on required equity payments and obstructed the
Mother’s attempts to retrieve her personal property, violating specific court orders
regarding property and financial obligations.
18. Father fraudulently signed Mother’s name to her 401K check and made a mobile deposit.
19. The Father delayed the initial equity payment for the marital residence and made payments
from an unauthorized account.
20. Father has failed to make the car payments for the 2018 Acura MDX as ordered, adversely
affecting the Mother's credit score. Father is currently one (1) month overdue on the
payment schedule for the 2018 Acura MDX. Further, Father has threatened to involve the
police on Mother because an automatic payment towards the loan on vehicle was made
from Father’s bank account.
21. Father has not divided the marital property as ordered in the Decree. Specifically, Mother
still has not received the following:
a. One half of the Parties wall décor;
b. Bedroom Lamps;
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 4 of 8
DOCUMENT 1
c. Half of Memory boxes;
d. Cricut supplies (the Cricut was broken by Father);
e. 75” TV, which was broken by Father and not usable;
f. Kids Clothes/A.K.’s Dance clothes/DVDs. Father did not provide AK’s dance,
preschool, pageant, or other home video DVDs;
g. Half of A.K.’s clothing. Father only gave Mother clothing that the child had
outgrown could no longer wear;
h. Half of A.K.’s dance awards;
i. Half of B.M.’s clothing. Father only gave Mother clothing that the child had
outgrown could no longer wear;
j. Half of “memories” in closet, including drawings/paintings/sentimental baby items,
photos etc.;
k. Bedding and pillows- Father provided one sheet and fitted sheet. No other bedding
was given.
l. Two white storage units;
m. Two framed silhouette pictures;
n. Euro Pillows
o. Beach Items;
p. Blankets;
q. Décor Items that were on the sofa table. Father broke the lamp, so it is unusable.
r. Credenza Décor Items;
s. Rae Dunn Collection- Father provided 25% of total collection and kept the rest.
Several pieces were intentionally broken by Father;
t. White serving items;
u. Crockpots;
v. Outdoor table umbrella. Father provided a broken umbrella that was in the
basement and not the umbrella ordered to be distributed.
w. Christmas Décor. Father kept the kids school made ornaments, the nutcrackers and
several boxes of décor items that were not provided;
x. Easter Décor;
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 5 of 8
DOCUMENT 1
y. Canon Camcorder and home videos;
z. The money the plaintiff received from the Cavapoo’s puppies was not provided to
Mother. Bailey had 5 puppies and upon notice that I wanted to keep one, he gifted
two of the puppies to Katie and Brian McGregor and Ally Brazzell. Three puppies
were sold.
22. These actions are willful and in direct violation of the Decree. Mother requests the Court
hold Father in willful contempt and grant the proper relief to Mother.
Failure to Consult on Child-Related Decisions in Violation of ¶ 13 of the Court’s Final Order:
23. Father has excluded Mother from important decisions concerning the children’s health,
education, and welfare, and has not informed her of significant events or allowed her
participation in the children's lives as mandated by the joint legal custody agreement.
24. Father failed to inform Mother about A.K.’s cheer practices and medical appointments,
including a significant event where A.K. was vaccinated against HPV without Mother’s
consent or knowledge.
25. Mother was falsely informed about the timing of AK’s etiquette dinner, preventing her
from participating, and was not given access to other school events, directly violating the
Decree.
26. These actions are willful and in direct violation of the Decree. Mother requests the Court
hold Father in willful contempt and grant the proper relief to Mother.
Blocking Communication in Violation of ¶15 of the Court’s Final Order:
27. The Father has frequently blocked Mother’s calls and messages, controlling when and if
A.K. can communicate with her Mother. This has been used as a tool to alienate Mother
further from her children, in direct violation of the decree that ensures daily communication
rights.
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 6 of 8
DOCUMENT 1
28. These actions are willful and in direct violation of the Decree. Mother requests the Court
hold Father in willful contempt and grant the proper relief to Mother.
Attorneys’ Fees:
29. Due to the Father’s willful violations of the Final Decree of Divorce, Mother has incurred
significant attorneys’ fees and costs. These expenses have been necessary to enforce her
rights and the Court’s orders. Consequently, Mother requests that the Court order Father to
reimburse these attorneys’ fees and costs as part of the relief granted in this action.
Show Cause Hearing:
30. Mother hereby requests the Court to schedule a hearing at the earliest possible date for
Father to show cause why he should not be found in contempt of the Final Decree of
Divorce.
WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, Petitioner respectfully prays that, upon final
hearing of this cause, this Court will grant the following relief:
A. Immediately set a hearing for Father to show cause as to why he has violated the
Decree.
B. Find Father in contempt of the Final Decree of Divorce dated February 27, 2024.
C. Impose appropriate sanctions to compel compliance with the Court’s orders.
D. Order immediate enforcement of Mother’s visitation rights.
E. Award Mother her attorneys’ fees and costs incurred as a result of this action.
F. Grant to Mother such other and further relief as the Court deems just, proper, and to
which in equity and good conscience she may be entitled.
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 7 of 8
DOCUMENT 1
Respectfully submitted this 2nd day of May 2024.
/s/ Barbara H. Agricola (AGR004)
Attorney for Petitioner
OF COUNSEL:
AGRICOLA LAW
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, Alabama 36801
Telephone: 334.759.7557
barbara@agricolalaw.com
www.agricolalaw.com
RESPONDENT TO BE SERVED VIA PROCESS SERVER OR CERTIFIED MAIL
Christopher Blaine McGregor
536 Rocky Creek Road
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Contempt Petition
Page 8 of 8
